keyword: how many calories in pound of ground beef
title: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pound of ground beef (80/20 lean), plus full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, and variations for cooking or leanness.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
assumptions: 80% lean, 20% fat, raw (uncooked); based on USDA data for standard ground beef; 1 pound ≈ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, brand, grinding, and cooking method (e.g., draining fat reduces calories). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of 80/20 raw ground beef contains about 1153 kcal and 78 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 1153 kcal for raw 80% lean ground beef.

faqs.q: Does cooking ground beef change the calories per pound?
faqs.a: Yes, cooking and draining fat can reduce it to ~950 kcal by removing some fat.

faqs.q: How much protein in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 78 g protein in one pound of raw 80/20 ground beef.

faqs.q: What affects calories in ground beef the most?
faqs.a: Fat percentage—leaner cuts (90/10) have fewer calories (~950 kcal/pound), fattier more.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground beef?
faqs.a: Raw; cooked weight shrinks, and draining fat lowers calories further.
